name: Device control_slider
description: Provides fine-grained control over a single device's attribute using a slider. This is ideal for adjusting continuous values like brightness, color temperature, or volume.
examples: I want to adjust the speaker's treble.
Change the office light to a warm white.

component_title.description: The name of the attribute being controlled by the slider (e.g., 'Brightness', 'Color Temperature').

current_value.description: The current numerical value of the attribute, typically within a 0-100 range.

slider.description: A container for the slider's visual components.

text_label.description: An array of two strings for the labels at the minimum and maximum ends of the slider track (e.g., `['Cool', 'Warm']` or `['Min', 'Max']`).

slider_handle.description: Indicates the presence or state of the draggable handle on the slider.

slider_track.description: Defines the visual style of the slider's track.

html:
{{ data.component_title }}

{{ data.current_value }} %

{{ data.slider.text_label[0] }}
